Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @Deleted User your seed will always work. The encrypt+password option is a quality of life feature where agama stores your seed in a text file and encrypts it with your password. Now you don't have to type/copy-paste seed everytime. Because typos when typing the seed will generate different addresses and user may not notice and lose funds. If your encrypt password is weak and an attacker got access to your seed file(created by agama and encryped), he can brute force your seed file by trying passwords again and again until one works.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Ah makes sense. Are there any limits to wrong attempts? Or unlimited

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: also where can I find the .pin file? Cant find in the komodo folder

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: and copy pasting the location in explorer doesnt seem to find it either

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: So safest method is saving the .pin file somewhere secure like an encrypted usb (no need to store the seed phrase anywhere at all) and use that to access funds

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <gcharang:matrix.org> no safest method is to save your seed written on a paper and storing it securely. Digital data can be lost in any number of ways. The encrypted text life is just for making users's life easier

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Don't backup your agama encrypted seeds in cloud services

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
.pin locations:
```
OSX: ~/Library/Application Support/Agama/shepherd/pin

WINDOWS: %appdata% → Roaming →  Agama → shepherd → pin

LINUX: ~/.agama/shepherd/pin/
```
